message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class TestStringTokenStrict {

public static void main(String[] args) {
    String input = "34 4 5 6 67 45 34";
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, " ");
    short[] shortsArray = new short[st.countTokens()];
    int i = 0;
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String token = st.nextToken();
        shortsArray[i++] = Short.parseShort(token);
    }
    for (short s : shortsArray) {
        System.out.println(s);
    }
}}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class is used to split the string into tokens by the specified delimiter, which is a space in this case. The countTokens() method is used to determine the size of the array. The while loop iterates over each token in the string, converts it to a short using the Short.parseShort() method, and stores it in the array. The for-each loop at the end prints out each short in the array to verify that the conversion was successful.
